intro: Hieracium yvesianum, commonly known as the Yvesian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium yvesianum is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
